p: A vaccine produced by immunizing mice with VLPs that incorporates full-length ZIKV structural proteins (C-prM-E) can also endow full protection against ZIKV and induces production of more ZIKV-neutralizing antibodies than DNA vaccines ( Garg et al., 2017). A chimeric live-attenuated ZIKV prM-E vaccine candidate, using a commercialized JEV vaccine as a backbone ( Li et al., 2018), has also demonstrated robust immunization and complete protection in both rhesus macaques and AG129 mice that present a receptor deficiency for interferon (IFN)-α/β and IFN-γ ( Lazear et al., 2016). The JEV prM-E was replaced with the corresponding prM-E from an Asian ZIKV strain. Another approach using chimeric ZIKV with DENV prM-E proteins or a chimeric DENV with ZIKV prM-E proteins revealed robust protection in immunized mice through the production of highly neutralizing antibodies ( Xie et al., 2017). The main concern with such vaccines is whether they will result in the emergence of naturally circulating genetically modified infectious viruses.
